intro: Oxytropis darpirensis, commonly known as the Darpirensis locoweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, particularly in countries like Kazakhstan and Uzbekistan. The plant is characterized by its tall, erect stems and clusters of small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several pairs of oval-shaped leaflets, and it thrives in dry, rocky habitats. Oxytropis darpirensis is known for its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil, which makes it an important plant in certain ecosystems.
